wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Mackenzie (1793 – 9 June 1856) was a British Conservative Party politician.Mackenzie was elected Conservative MP for Ross and Cromarty at a by-election in 1837—caused by the resignation of James Alexander Stewart-Mackenzie—and held the seat until 1847 when he did not seek re-election.

response: Sir Thomas Mackenzie (1853–1930) was Prime Minister of New Zealand in 1912, and later High Commissioner.
Thomas Mackenzie may also refer to:
*Thomas Mackenzie (Royal Navy officer) (1753–1813), Royal Navy admiral
*Thomas Mackenzie (Scottish politician) (1793–1856), MP for Ross and Cromarty, 1837–1847
*Thomas Mackenzie (Australian politician) (1854–1934), member of the New South Wales Legislative Assembly
*Thomas Mackenzie (1789–1822), Member of parliament for Ross-shire, 1818–1822
